title: Youth arrested with over 3kg of heroin in Veyangoda
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of 3 kilograms and 655 grams of heroin in Veyangoda, Police said.

title: Prevailing showery conditions to reduce from today
byline: The prevailing showery condition in the southwestern part of the island is expected to reduce gradually from today (01), the Department of Meteorology has said.

title: 71 killed due to excessive pre-monsoon rains in India’s Karnataka
byline: The office of the Chief Minister of India’s Karnataka state has said that 71 people lost their lives due to excessive pre-monsoon showers in the state since April.

title: 10,000 people in 14 districts affected by adverse weather across Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 10,270 individuals from 2,757 families have been affected by the adverse weather conditions prevailing in the country, according to the Disaster Management Center.

title: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan opens up about mental health struggle
byline: Comedian Romesh Ranganathan has said he is in “one of the best places I’ve ever been in my life”, after years of struggling with his mental health.

title: National Tax Week from tomorrow
byline: The ‘National Tax Week’ declared by the government to increase awareness on taxation and also to widen the tax base in the country, will begin tomorrow (02).

title: Names of Mayors and Chairpersons of several LG bodies gazetted
byline: A gazette extraordinary has been issued containing the names of Mayors, Deputy Mayors, Chairpersons, and Vice-Chairpersons of several local government institutions.

title: Sri Lankan economy remains resilient supported by healthy inflows: CBSL
byline: The external sector of the Sri Lankan economy remained resilient in April 2025, supported by healthy inflows from tourist earnings and workers’ remittances, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

title: Rail services along Main Line affected due to train derailment
byline: Rail services along the Main Line have been affected following a train derailment adjacent to the Galaboda railway station.

title: Warning after millions of bees escape overturned truck in US
byline: Millions of bees escaped from an overturned truck in the US state of Washington on Friday, sparking warnings from authorities for the public to avoid the swarm.

title: No price revision in June: Laugfs Gas
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC has announced that the company will not revise domestic LP gas prices for the month of June 2025.

title: At least seven dead after Russian bridge collapses on to train
byline: At least seven people have died after a highway bridge collapsed on to railway tracks in Russia close to the Ukraine border, according to emergency services.

title: Health authorities warn of spike in dengue and chikungunya cases
byline: There has been an increase in diseases such as influenza, chikungunya, and dengue among children, Dr. Deepal Perera, the Consultant Paediatrician at the Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children has stated.

title: Google says it will appeal online search antitrust decision
byline: Alphabet’s Google on Saturday said it will appeal an antitrust decision under which a federal judge proposed less aggressive ways to restore online search competition than the 10-year regime suggested by antitrust enforcers.

title: Maradana Overhead Bridge: A disaster waiting to happen?
byline: The Maradana overhead bridge is a pedestrian bridge used daily by thousands of people to cross the main road safely.

title: Over 120,000 tourist arrivals recorded in May
byline: The number of tourists who arrived in the country in the month of May has increased to 120,120, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority has announced.

title: Sri Lanka must take practical steps to join BRICS - Russian Ambassador
byline: If Sri Lanka is interested in joining the BRICS alliance, the country must take practical steps, says the Russian Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Levan S. Jagaryan.

title: LG bodies to be formed under new Mayors and Chairpersons tomorrow
byline: Formation of 161 local government institutions under a new Mayor or a Chairperson, where a single party or an independent group has obtained majority at the recently concluded Local Government (LG) election will take place tomorrow (02).

title: Israeli attack near aid delivery point kills 30 in Rafah
byline: An Israeli attack near an aid distribution point run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF) killed at least 30 people in Rafah, Palestinian news agency WAFA and Hamas-affiliated media said on Sunday.

title: Motorcycle theft suspect arrested after brawl with police in Melsiripura
byline: A suspect who had stolen a motorcycle from a woman at knife point and fled the area has been arrested by officers of the Melsiripura Police while at a restaurant’s parking lot in the Melsiripura area.

title: Over 70,000 electricity breakdowns reported across Sri Lanka
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that, as of 5.00 p.m. today (June 01), a total of 70,012 electricity breakdowns have been reported across the country over the past 69 hours, due to prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Road accident in Nigeria kills 22 athletes returning from sports festival
byline: A bus veered off a bridge in Nigeria’s northern state of Kano, killing at least 22 athletes returning home from a sports festival and leaving several other passengers injured, the state’s governor said.

title: Search continues for Indonesia quarry collapse victims, death toll at 17
byline: Indonesian authorities will continue searching on Sunday for eight people trapped in a rock collapse at a quarry in West Java, where the death toll has reached 17 with six injured, the search and rescue agency Basarnas said.

title: ‘Bandula Barb’ habitat to be declared a conservation zone
byline: The Ministry of Environment has decided to designate the area where the endangered Pethia bandula, commonly known as the Bandula Barb, a species of cyprinid endemic to Sri Lanka, lives as a conservation zone.

title: Showers expected to continue; nearly 10,000 still affected by adverse weather
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, and North-western provinces, as well as in the Galle and Matara districts tomorrow (June 2), the Department of Meteorology says.

title: July bus fare revision postponed to August
byline: The Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) says it has been decided to postpone the annual bus fare revision, which was scheduled to be implemented in July, until August.

title: 12 shot, 1 dead in North Carolina overnight shooting
byline: One person is dead and at least 12 others were injured in a mass shooting during a party at a western North Carolina residence, according to the Catawba County Sheriff’s Office.
